title: How to Model a Balloon Rabbit with a Carrot

steps.headline: Blow up the balloon.
steps.description: Place the lip of a white 260Q balloon over the nib of your pump. Inflate the balloon leaving about a 2 inch (5.1 cm) tail.

steps.headline: Tie off the balloon.
steps.description:
Loop the lip around your fingers, then tuck it through the loop. Gently pull and release to form the knot. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/3\/38\/Model-a-Balloon-Rabbit-with-a-Carrot-Step-2Bullet1.jpg\/v4-459px-Model-a-Balloon-Rabbit-with-a-Carrot-Step-2Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/3\/38\/Model-a-Balloon-Rabbit-with-a-Carrot-Step-2Bullet1.jpg\/v4-759px-Model-a-Balloon-Rabbit-with-a-Carrot-Step-2Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"}

steps.headline: Create the rabbit's head.
steps.description: Twist a 2 inch (5.1 cm) bubble for the rabbit's head.

steps.headline: Make the long ears.
Create the neck.
steps.description: Twist a small bubble for the neck

steps.headline: Make the front legs.
Prepare the body.
steps.description:
Make a bubble for the body the same size as the rabbit's head. Squeeze all the air down to the end of the balloon so it is fully inflated. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/f\/f0\/Model-a-Balloon-Rabbit-with-a-Carrot-Step-7Bullet2.jpg\/v4-459px-Model-a-Balloon-Rabbit-with-a-Carrot-Step-7Bullet2.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/f\/f0\/Model-a-Balloon-Rabbit-with-a-Carrot-Step-7Bullet2.jpg\/v4-759px-Model-a-Balloon-Rabbit-with-a-Carrot-Step-7Bullet2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"}

steps.headline: Build the back legs and tail.
Draw a face.
Make the carrot.
steps.description: Take a160Q orange balloon and inflate it a tiny bit. Tie it off and then tie a knot in the other end of the balloon where the tail begins. Snip off the rest of the tail with your scissors.

steps.headline: Add leaves.
steps.description: Next take a green 160Q balloon. Cut off the knot end. Loop the green balloon round your fingers and catch the knot of the orange balloon in the loop. Then tie a knot in the green balloon for the carrot's leaves.

steps.headline: Add the carrot.
steps.description: Pop the carrot into the legs of the rabbit.

text:
Blow up the balloon. Place the lip of a white 260Q balloon over the nib of your pump. Inflate the balloon leaving about a 2 inch (5.1 cm) tail. Tie off the balloon. Loop the lip around your fingers, then tuck it through the loop. Gently pull and release to form the knot. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/38/Model-a-Balloon-Rabbit-with-a-Carrot-Step-2Bullet1.jpg/v4-459px-Model-a-Balloon-Rabbit-with-a-Carrot-Step-2Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/38/Model-a-Balloon-Rabbit-with-a-Carrot-Step-2Bullet1.jpg/v4-759px-Model-a-Balloon-Rabbit-with-a-Carrot-Step-2Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Create the rabbit's head. Twist a 2 inch (5.1 cm) bubble for the rabbit's head. Make the long ears. Make two 5 inch (12.7 cm) bubbles twisting in the same direction. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/14/Model-a-Balloon-Rabbit-with-a-Carrot-Step-4Bullet1.jpg/v4-459px-Model-a-Balloon-Rabbit-with-a-Carrot-Step-4Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/14/Model-a-Balloon-Rabbit-with-a-Carrot-Step-4Bullet1.jpg/v4-759px-Model-a-Balloon-Rabbit-with-a-Carrot-Step-4Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Twist them together to lock them off. These will be the rabbit's long ears. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/1f/Model-a-Balloon-Rabbit-with-a-Carrot-Step-4Bullet2.jpg/v4-459px-Model-a-Balloon-Rabbit-with-a-Carrot-Step-4Bullet2.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/1f/Model-a-Balloon-Rabbit-with-a-Carrot-Step-4Bullet2.jpg/v4-759px-Model-a-Balloon-Rabbit-with-a-Carrot-Step-4Bullet2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Create the neck. Twist a small bubble for the neck Make the front legs. Add two 2 inch (5.1 cm) bubbles and lock them off for short front legs. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/c1/Model-a-Balloon-Rabbit-with-a-Carrot-Step-6Bullet1.jpg/v4-459px-Model-a-Balloon-Rabbit-with-a-Carrot-Step-6Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/c1/Model-a-Balloon-Rabbit-with-a-Carrot-Step-6Bullet1.jpg/v4-759px-Model-a-Balloon-Rabbit-with-a-Carrot-Step-6Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Position the rest of the balloon so that it is horizontal. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/22/Model-a-Balloon-Rabbit-with-a-Carrot-Step-6Bullet2.jpg/v4-459px-Model-a-Balloon-Rabbit-with-a-Carrot-Step-6Bullet2.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/22/Model-a-Balloon-Rabbit-with-a-Carrot-Step-6Bullet2.jpg/v4-759px-Model-a-Balloon-Rabbit-with-a-Carrot-Step-6Bullet2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Prepare the body. Make a bubble for the body the same size as the rabbit's head. Squeeze all the air down to the end of the balloon so it is fully inflated. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/f0/Model-a-Balloon-Rabbit-with-a-Carrot-Step-7Bullet2.jpg/v4-459px-Model-a-Balloon-Rabbit-with-a-Carrot-Step-7Bullet2.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/f0/Model-a-Balloon-Rabbit-with-a-Carrot-Step-7Bullet2.jpg/v4-759px-Model-a-Balloon-Rabbit-with-a-Carrot-Step-7Bullet2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Build the back legs and tail. Make two long bubbles for back legs leaving a small bubble at the end of the balloon for the cottontail. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/a5/Model-a-Balloon-Rabbit-with-a-Carrot-Step-8Bullet1.jpg/v4-459px-Model-a-Balloon-Rabbit-with-a-Carrot-Step-8Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/a5/Model-a-Balloon-Rabbit-with-a-Carrot-Step-8Bullet1.jpg/v4-759px-Model-a-Balloon-Rabbit-with-a-Carrot-Step-8Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Lock the legs off leaving the bubble sticking up at the bottom. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/bd/Model-a-Balloon-Rabbit-with-a-Carrot-Step-8Bullet2.jpg/v4-459px-Model-a-Balloon-Rabbit-with-a-Carrot-Step-8Bullet2.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/bd/Model-a-Balloon-Rabbit-with-a-Carrot-Step-8Bullet2.jpg/v4-759px-Model-a-Balloon-Rabbit-with-a-Carrot-Step-8Bullet2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Push the front legs in between the back legs to make your rabbit sit up. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/00/Model-a-Balloon-Rabbit-with-a-Carrot-Step-8Bullet3.jpg/v4-459px-Model-a-Balloon-Rabbit-with-a-Carrot-Step-8Bullet3.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/00/Model-a-Balloon-Rabbit-with-a-Carrot-Step-8Bullet3.jpg/v4-759px-Model-a-Balloon-Rabbit-with-a-Carrot-Step-8Bullet3.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Draw a face. Use scissors to carefully trim the knot on the nose. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/33/Model-a-Balloon-Rabbit-with-a-Carrot-Step-9Bullet1.jpg/v4-459px-Model-a-Balloon-Rabbit-with-a-Carrot-Step-9Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/33/Model-a-Balloon-Rabbit-with-a-Carrot-Step-9Bullet1.jpg/v4-759px-Model-a-Balloon-Rabbit-with-a-Carrot-Step-9Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Take a permanent marker pen and draw on eyes and a mouth with buck teeth. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/cb/Model-a-Balloon-Rabbit-with-a-Carrot-Step-9Bullet2.jpg/v4-459px-Model-a-Balloon-Rabbit-with-a-Carrot-Step-9Bullet2.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/cb/Model-a-Balloon-Rabbit-with-a-Carrot-Step-9Bullet2.jpg/v4-759px-Model-a-Balloon-Rabbit-with-a-Carrot-Step-9Bullet2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Make the carrot. Take a160Q orange balloon and inflate it a tiny bit. Tie it off and then tie a knot in the other end of the balloon where the tail begins. Snip off the rest of the tail with your scissors. Add leaves. Next take a green 160Q balloon. Cut off the knot end. Loop the green balloon round your fingers and catch the knot of the orange balloon in the loop. Then tie a knot in the green balloon for the carrot's leaves. Add the carrot. Pop the carrot into the legs of the rabbit.
